WRITING.TEXT: "Never been. Sounds like I should visit it. Earlier, you mentioned a trade route. Theoretically, would you be interested in being part of a block of worlds that are fringe worlds, out on the edge of the galaxy? Working to try and raise their galactic profile, as well as establishing trade between each other and what have you?"
"That was an ulterior motive, yes. See who might be game. But, primarily, it's what it says on the tin, as it were. Plus, I mean, who doesn't love free stuff?"
"As am I. Well, at least like-located beings. Outer edges and such."
"So, I take it Coruscant is a welcome relief. Or at least a respite?"
"As am I. I want to bring in more trade, hopefully some tourism, to Akiva. But, to do that, we actually need listed hyperspace routes. And to be on maps."
"None, really. The occasional ambush, but I mostly just worked on my ships. I figured, since I was probably going to lose, free publicity for my shops, you know?"
"Chit-chat, mostly."

"Oh, yes, there was. I meant that enough people got a petition together to get me on the ballot, just without me knowing. Then the local elections commission showed up at my shop and wanted to verify my information before putting me on the ballot. That was the first I'd heard of my Senate run."
Gannit snickered a bit.
"Spend only a few hundred credits on the campaign. A few ads that said "Vote Gannit". I won with 80% of the vote."
"My door's always open." Gannit said, greeting his friend.
"Well, I can guarantee you that it won't be a torture dungeon. But you may have to share a two bed flat with ten other sentients. Half of which, minimum, will be spice-addicted."

"I dunno. I'm already pushing middle-aged and I still feel like there is some adventure to be had. Y'know, maybe that's why I let them draft me for the senate race." Gannit sits, silent pondering for a moment. "Sorry. Had a moment of self-psychoanalysis there."

"Sense of humor. Always good to see. So you know, whatever he's paying you, I can offer you 100% less, no perks and you have to pay your own cab fare to and from the Senate every day. What do you think? Want to be my personal assistant?" Gannit winks.
"Understood. Well, if you ever need anything, my door's always open. Even if it's just a recommendation for a restaurant for dinner." Gannit smiled and let the Muun eat in peace.
"Indeed. Well, at least you're not in a Jawa camp," says Gannit with a big smile and jovial slap on the Herglik's shoulder.

"I will be back shortly."
Gannit heads down the corridor to the private back room and, after a few moments, returns with some fresh hot roast beef bites.
"There ya go. Are you sure all is well? You seem a bitdistracted? Like your mind is elsewhere."
"Anything I can help with, Senator?" asked Gannit in a calming and concerned tone.
"And please call me Gannit. Please, enjoy." Gannit gestures into the room.
"Of course. Pleasure to meet you." Gannit shakes his hand. "I've never met a Herglik before, truth be told."

"Just wanted to return the visit. See your office. Maybe steal a few of your decorations for my office." Gannit laughed.
"How are you settling in?"

"Well, thank you. If there's any room, you can place it on the hors d'oeuvres table. If there's not, go ahead and move one of the small tables over. This is your Herglic friend, I take it? Pleasure to meet you."
"Some blue milk, if you have it? Preferably cold." Gannit enters Tevv's office.

"Pleasure to meet you, Senator Bullyetm. Senator Glenn. Thank you for the gifts." Gannit accepts the bottles with a smile.
"Please, step inside and mingle to your hearts content."

"Good to hear. What is Csilla like? I've heard that it makes Hoth look like Tatooine. Then again, I've also heard that Chiss have forked tongues and ritually eat their own babies. So, " Gannit shrugs and smiles.
"Hello again, friend. Welcome to the festivities," Gannit jovially greets the arrival of Rurik and Mul.
[meta] I thought I had.

"Greetings Senator Nuruodo. Thank you for the bottle. I am familiar with the Chiss. One once stopped by my shop on Akiva for a refuel. If I recall correctly, you abbreviate your names, yes? Might I ask what your full name is, if it is not uncouth?"
"I am Gannit Valeris, senator for Akiva. I assume you are his aide?"
"What brought me here was a freighter. No, but seriously, I'm here to help raise Akiva's profile. Bring in more trade and, hopefully, some tourists. And you?"
"Greetings, Senator Sentar, I am Gannit Valeris, senator for Akiva. Please, help yourself to refreshments."

WRITING.TITLE: [LOBBY] The Senator from Akiva invites all those from the edges of the galaxy to a meet-and-greet in his office. Refreshments will be served.
WRITING.TEXT:
The room is still undecorated, the desk pushed against the window, but there are several more chairs around the office, as well as a few small tables, all borrowed from the Senate's storage facilities.
Alcohols, juices, fizzy beverages, and, the Senator's favorite, blue milk, are all chilled on a large table, sitting beside a table of snacks and small hors d'oeuvres.
The Senator stands at the door, awaiting arrivals.
[meta] The Senator also extends a personal invitation to the Senator from Dac, /u/darthstem.
Gannit walks up to the door and knocks, patiently waiting.
Gannit walks up to the door and calmly knocks, waiting for a reply.
"Duran, pleasure to see you again," said Gannit warmly.

"Have we? Now that you mention it, I do remember records from one of our outlying sites that mentioned Ithorians. Was this about four, five years ago?" Gannit asked genuinely.
"What were Ithorians doing so far from home, if I may ask?"
"Well, that is fantastic," Gannit said excitedly. "I apologize, but I feel like I should, perhaps, prepare a meeting for you, myself and any others. If you would kindly excuse me?"
"Thanks. I guess, while we're in the neighborhood, besides mud water and scrap metal, what else does your planet have to offer?"

"Mostly just trying to get more trade going, maybe some hotels for tourists, but trade mostly. Even if we become a large stop for freighters between the east and west of the galaxy, it'll be a lot better than we are now.
And, actually, I was discussing, in theoretical terms, about assembling an "Edge World" block, sort of a caucus of smaller worlds on the fringes of the galaxy, looking to raise their profile. My thought is that we'd work together to help raise our own planets profile both through Senate legislation, and perhaps even interplanetary trade. Any interest? I wouldn't want to act on anything until I get a few worlds committed, but," Gannit shrugs, "Just an idea i had."

"Akiva is mostly a stop-over planet, but we have the potential to be a big tourist spot, lots of great views and everything, but we're in the middle of nowhere. And, actually, I run, well, just own now, a chain of starship repair shops. Need to get used to saying that instead. Anyway, we are always in need of pieces and parts, since we get every sort of thing coming through. Mostly old, well, to be blunt, pieces of poodoo coming through that it's hard to find parts for anymore. Maybe our planets could strike up some sort of deal in the not-too-distant future."
Gannit pauses for a beat.
"Scratch that. No. Sorry. Still thinking business. What's good for my business isn't necessarily good for the planet."
"As far as legislation, I've got a couple ideas, but nothing concrete. Where is Belgaroth? To be perfectly honest, the name doesn't sound familiar."

Gannit takes a long sip of the milk.
"Many thanks, Duran. Ahhh. Excellent. I'm not much of one for alcohol. But I'm addicted to blue milk. So delicious."
Gannit takes another long sip.
"So far, so good. Everyone I've met seems friendly enough, even the colder ones I can tell are just guarded because I'm the new guy, so they don't know me and whatever agenda I have yet. As far as goals and aspirations, I'm looking to put Akiva on the map, as it were. Not necessarily Coruscant by any means, or even Naboo, but to where people actually know about where it is."
Gannit takes an extra long sip of the cold blue milk.

"Apparently my reputation precedes me. Huh. That's a sentence I never thought I'd say. Anyway, it's a pleasure to meet you, Senator Sundar."
Gannit extends a hand.
"No, sir. Figured I'd drop in and introduce myself. Closest I've come to actually meeting an Ithorian was I was getting lunch at a stall on the main road in town, and about two, three hundred meters away an Ithorian was walking and turned a corner. I'm so worldly, I know. Jealous?" Gannit chuckled.

"Gotcha. Okay. Sorry about that. Just wondering, since like the IBC could have a Muun rep, but there's also the Muunilinst senator, y'know? So, you are the senator for Sullust, but also a rep for Sullust's interests within the CG?"
Mmhmm. :)

"Well, part of why I'm here is to raise our profile. Or at least try to. We have some rather gorgeous views, but being out in the middle of nowhere means that only locals have seen them."
Gannit leaned in a bit.
"So, if I may ask, to clarify, do you represent Sullust as part of the CG, or the CG itself?"

"Thank you. Some blue milk, if you have any? Preferably cold?"
Gannit was gambling that the Senator didn't, but you never know.
"Makes sense. Though, I can tell you that is not why I am dropping by, since I didn't know until just now. I'm just making the rounds, meeting my colleagues. So, if I may ask, which do you prefer, Mon Cal, Mon Cala or Mon Calamari? Just so I know, for future reference."

WRITING.TITLE: [Meta] We need to establish a common reference time for in-game events
WRITING.TEXT:
For things like "Snacks and drinks tonight at the Alderaanian senator's office. Come by and meet your old friends and new faces. Tonight, 2000"
I was thinking that US Central Time could be used. (In the interest of full disclosure, this is my time zone, but my motive is not selfish...mostly)
I was thinking because, since most of us are likely from the mainland US, it would be a good common point of reference, since 2000 Central is 7PM Mountain and 6PM Pacific and 9PM Eastern, so all within reasonable waking hours.
Plus, it's got the "C" needed to mean Coruscant. Like 2000 CT would be 8:00 PM US Central and 8:00 PM Coruscant Standard Time.
I removed the middle S/D since Coruscant probably doesn't have bullshit Daylight Savings Time.
Alternatively, we could use UTC, but, again, since most of us are likely from the US, it would mean anything that happens at night would be at midnight in-game. So, like an event at 8PM would be at 1AM UTC.
Thoughts?

Gannit, concluding his meeting with the Mon Cal senator, stopped in at the door to the Ithorian office.
Gannit politely knocked and waited for a response.

"It went okay. Being from a nowhere world meant I only got two or three drop-bys, but I think I've made some compatriots. How goes yours?"
Gannit took a seat.
"Oh. Gannit Valeris, by the way. Akiva." He extended a hand.

Gannit Valeris, having concluded his open office session for the day, decided to venture through the halls, partly to mentally map offices, but also to see who else was around.
He walked past the office with the plaque for the Mon Cal senator. He saw that he was having an open office session, so Gannit decided to stop in.
He knocked on the door and patiently waited.

"Gotcha. Well, it's getting late. I'm gonna make a brief swing by my office and then try and sleep off some of this flight-lag. It's a little after 0900 on Akiva right now, so you can see my issues. But feel free to swing by my office anytime. I'm in the directory. Have a great night."
[meta] This is really just so I can synchronize Gannit's timeline, since he's had an open office session the following day already and met a few others.

"Oh, most definitely not. I was wondering, how do you feel about Sullust's place on the map, as it were? Does Sullust get enough galactic attention, or do you have to remind people where it is? Just curious."
[meta] Sorry about the delay. Dinner, TV and homework.

Gannit nods in understanding. "When you said duel, I was picturing something from the old tales, like the two of you on speeders with lances racing at each other, or with metal swords fighting to the death. But, then again, blasters are a more civilized weapon for a more civilized age."
[meta] Sorry for the delay. I was having dinner and watching TV and doing homework.

"Sounds fun. I'm pretty decent at pazaak myself. As far as issues, I'm just along for the ride for the first little while. Granted, if something comes up that affects Akiva, I'll jump in, but if it's something to do with the hyperlanes between here, Alderaan and Kashyyyk, I'll just watch protocol and rules of order. Make sense?"
[meta] I'd definitely suggest AND first (it's also a Rebels prequel, how Kanan and Hera met). The deuteragonist becomes a protagonist in *Aftermath*.

"Well, we're backwater and mostly get stop-offs. Some traders and freighters. In short, our last senator became a politician, looking out for himself first. The public liked me enough to draft me in the election and I won, that's the long and short of it."
Gannit leans in with interest. "So, how do these duels work? Guns? Swords? Bareknuckle?"
"Ah. Okay. So, how did you come into politics?"
"Sorry to hear that. Working 20 years on starships, most'd've lost at least a few fingers, but I'm big on safety. The Herglic friend, is that the associate of yours?"

"Long. Three weeks. But pleasant. Had some audioshows from Akiva that I was behind on, so I got caught up on those. Plenty of reading too. But, yes. A plascrete jungle is Coruscant. And you? How was your trip?
[meta] Yes. It's good. Plus, being a brand new planet gives me 300 years of history to make up. Some people were thrown by the writing style, but I didn't mind. Have you read *A New Dawn*? If not, I'd suggest you read it before you read *Aftermath*. Gives you more context on a major character.

"Boy, what a wonderful sentient he was," Gannit said with a heavy dose of sarcasm. "If you don't mind my asking, uh, what's the story with..." Gannit held up his hand, but with his ring finger folded back.
"Indeed. Though this one knew I was on a tight schedule, and he was hauling, well, let's call them "Hutt-funded goods" from Tatooine to Coruscant, so he wasn't going to be taking his time either."

"Thanks. So do you. Yeah. Ours didn't even bother. He just voted with the majority, took his pay and his only goal was 'how can I get richer'. He's back on Akiva now, but no one will do business with him. Last I heard, he's living here, on planet, in a penthouse somewhere. I mean, if you're a senator and your planet hates you, well, you messed up."

"It was on the long side, three weeks, and that's with a Class 3. I came in on a bulk freighter, since those are the only real long-distance ships that come through. Fortunately, one was on its way here just as I was, so the captain let me hop on. I fly too, but it's a short-range. I can get out to Naboo, maybe a little more, before I need to fuel up again. First thing I'm gonna do when I get my paycheck is save up for a long-range personal shuttle, hopefully with a 2 or even a 1.75 so I can go back and forth quicker."
"I completely understand. That was me last night. I'm still packed. How long was your trip? How'd you get here?"

"Fascinating. I once worked on King of Naboo's ship. He was on his way to...somewhere and his hyperdrive shorted out. Spent a two months at sublight, he was stuck in The Barrens. Caused a hell of a stir on Naboo, I saw in the news later."
Gannit paused. "That's what we call the area around Akiva," he said, making a circle with his finger. "We're the only habitable world in the region. Anyway, turns out whoever did his last service, instead of replacing the power cabling just taped it up. Well, when the tape wore out and the wires became exposed, it shorted out on the underside of the deck plating. From the looks of it, it was a 50/50 shot of short out or overload and boom. Fortunately, it was the better 50."
"I've met the Kaminoan senator. She's a bit cold, but seems friendly. Have yet to meet the Bespinian or Mon Cal senators. I'll put out an ask towards the Kaminoan and you towards Bespin and Mon Cal?"

INCOMING CHAT MESSAGE: "A duel? Fascinating. I'd love to hear about it some time. Our previous senator was like yours. Got too self-interested. My win was far less interesting, I just got four times the votes he did."
Gannit paused to consider the rest of the message.
"As for this theoretical block, what worlds might be interested, as I'm sure you are more familiar than I with our colleagues."

Gannit was visibly taken aback at the distance. "Sounds like Akiva. Kind of way out of the way. Nobody knows where it is. Sorry if I'm the five thousandth person to ask you that. Maybe down the line, we could create a sort of 'Edge Worlds' block? Once we get a few more interested members, though?" Gannit shrugged.

Gannit shook Val's hand. "Pleased to meet you, sir." He paused a moment to process the comment. "I was? Wow. I'm quite flattered. Well, I'm not native to politics, no." Gannit shrugged. "We do? Please, go on."

Gannit returned the bow.
"I may have to visit one day. Take you up on this beauty. I have seen a few holo-stills. It seems that it is more impressive in person. But, I won't keep you any longer. Have a pleasant day, ma'am." Gannit extends a hand.

Gannit smiled at the positive reply.
SUBJ: Re: Re: Greetings from Akiva MESSAGE: Fantastic! I will likely be concluding my open-office session soon. Perhaps we could meet later today?
Yours in future trade, Gannit Valeris
"Oh, it's quite alright. I still have no idea how I'm going to decorate it. I'm in no rush. So, how is Kamino? What is it like?" He paused. "Unless you must depart? I wouldn't want to keep you."

Valeris stood.
"Gannit, please. And you're lucky that was my job, or I might be offended," he said with a smile and a laugh. "But, yes. This is only my second day in politics. I was kinda drafted, actually. But hey, if I'm who they wanted then who am I to say no? Might I ask your name?"

"Very different from Akiva. Much busier. Much louder. Still getting settled in, as you can see." He gestured to the room. "I still haven't even unpacked my luggage, actually." Gannit chuckled. "And you, ma'am?"

INCOMING MESSAGE, the screen blinked.
SUBJ: Greetings from Akiva
MESSAGE: Greetings from Gannit Valeris, the Senator from Akiva. I apologize not introducing myself in person, but I am having an open-door office session at the moment, as well as working on design and decoration ideas for my office. As an owner of a starship repair service on my world, and having a goal of increasing trade to my world, my company has a great need for starship parts. I have heard of the world Raxus Prime, a world of starship parts. I am not sure if the world is real or legend, but if it does exist, I may be interested in working out a trade deal. If the world is only of legends, I apologize for wasting your time and allow my to buy you a drink at Space Nate's to apologize.
Many thanks, and have a pleasant day.
-Gannit Valeris, Senator for Akiva

"Oh. My sincerest apologies, ma'am. I've never met a Kaminoan," he said, nodding towards her, "or a Quermian. I know from word-of-mouth that your people and theirs look similar. I hope I didn't offend."
"Oh, no need to apologize. He seemed friendly. I'm Gannit Valeris, senator from Akiva." He stands and extends a hand across the desk. "Kamino or Quermia?"
"I am. Please, come in. Take a seat." He gestured to the three simple folding chairs in front of his desk.

WRITING.TITLE: [LOBBY] Office of the Senator from Akiva
WRITING.TEXT:
He sat at the plain wooden desk in the empty, unadorned office in a simple suit jacket, tunic and slacks.
Gannit Valeris had yet to decorate his new office, aside from the three simple folding chairs in front of his desk that he had borrowed from the Senate storage room. That and he wasn't sure what sort of theme he would want. Akivan? Coruscanti? He'd decide later. He hadn't even hired an aide or staff yet.
For now, he's leave the door open and see who decided to drop by.
Gannit returned the bow and departed for his apartment.
"I am. Though, less lonely than I was. I just met the Senator from Corulag. Nice to meet you. Gannit Valeris, Akiva. Reaper's World? Haven't heard of it. Where is it?"
"Oh. My apologies, ma'am. I wasn't aware. I completely understand." Gannit dries his hands and extends one for the owed handshake. "It was a pleasure meeting youFrea."

"Understood." Gannit said with a smile. "Well, I have one or two stops to make on my way out. If you'll excuse me, I'm a bit space-lagged from the trip here from Akiva. Need to get onto the planet's schedule. It was a pleasure meeting you, sir, and best of luck to you."
Gannit gives Alarik a nod and departs.
([meta] It's late. I'm tired. Time for me to go to bed.)
"Here's my card. Feel free to message me anytime. Pleasure to meet you. Have a pleasant evening." Gannit gives a smile and departs.
"Oh, you're running for Chancellor? Or Vice-Chair?"

"If I can! Ha! But, yeah. Friendliness and cordiality, as well as acceptance of guilt when you mess up, goes a long way. Let's people know you're human and don't think yourself above them. I have a standing appointment with everyone on Akiva, that if I start turning out like the last guy, they can come here and slap me hard and tell me to get my stuff together, and that I'll comp them for the trip out and back if they do make the journey to hit my face."
Gannit pats him on the back and leaves him his card. He finishes his blue milk and departs.

"Sounds like it's not quite what you had hoped." Gannit gives a comforting pat to Jocelyn's shoulder.
"You know, maybe Bactoid will want to open a new branch on Akiva soon. And maybe they'll need someone to head it up, eh?" Gannit lets out a small chuckle and sips his blue milk.

"Interesting. So, can any of you who are not Jedi still fall to the Dark Side?" Gannit asked with genuine inquiry.
"As for my arrival here, I saw the announcement of the Near-Human block you were putting together, so I figured that, while your door was open, I would introduce myself. To be honest, I was expecting a 'hi-and-bye' situation. But your generosity is very much appreciated."
Gannit steps into the washroom, leaving the door ajar so the conversation may continue, and washes his hands thoroughly, getting as much grime and gunk off of them and out from under his nails as he can.
"Bactoid? Or someone else?"

"There are. Know anyone interested? I mean, if on my first day, I could tell home that I landed a KDY branch? That would be something. But, yeah, no. There is plenty of room for enterprise. I mean, even if a transgalactic hotel set up a few places, that'd be plenty." Gannit lets out a scoff of laughter.
"Yeah, I've heard that about Hutts. But, then again, if you treat them politely, I'm sure even the nastiest Hutts'll give you some leeway if you mess up. Buy your fingers some reprieve."

"Well, thank you, ma'am. I was going to be heading to my apartment after I conclude here, to unpack and wash up, but thank you. I'll owe you a handshake once I'm cleaned up, how's that?" Gannit said with a smile.
"The Force? Interesting. Never seen it in use. So, can you pick up a speeder or anything, or maybe a piece of fruit? Or is it more of a sixth sense, pardon the phrase?"
"Well, thank you, sir." Gannit said with a smile. "So, if I may ask, are you a Senator?"

"Well, now, I don't want to let all my secrets out, do I?" Gannit winks. "Mostly because I have none to tell. To be honest, I figure cordiality, as well as Akiva being something of an "untamed wilderness", relative even to Tatooine, will be appealing. Plus, no Hutts. Well, permanent resident Hutts. To make a long story short, I met a Hutt once, repairing his ship. Smelled to all hell, but rather friendly. I was rather surprised. For a gangster, he was rather gentlemanly."

"Not much of a drinker, myself, but I do enjoy blue milk." Gannit takes the last swig and raises his hand to signal for a refill.
"Like you said, Akiva is kind of out of the way, mostly an 'on the way' stop for fuel or a quick repair, the latter of which is my business. Largest repair shop chain on the planet. Which, all things considered, isn't saying much. We do get traders and the like in, though. Enough to keep things going, not enough to make anyone rich. If we got traffic like Coruscant did, the planet would collapse under the weight of the ships. I'm here just to raise our profile and make Akiva a bit more attractive to travellers and traders. Maybe drum up some Outer Rim outposts for the Feds or the IBC or whoever. That's it, basically. You?"

"Akiva fares well. At least, as of three weeks ago. Spotty comms on bulk freighters, unfortunately. Haven't checked news since my arrival. Great start to my senatorial career, not keeping up with my planet." Gannit lets out a small laughing scoff.
"As far as our concerns and goals go, I'm here to help put Akiva on the map, so to speak. Try and make it a larger trading post in the Outer Rim. That's, really, my number one goal here. I'm going to play the rest by ear. Best laid plans of womprats and men and all that. And Corulag?"

"Perhaps, after I get to know you, ma'am, and I've managed to settle in more. I apologize. I'm still a bit of a whaladon out of water around here. I'd shake your hand, but my hands are still kind of dirty from the travel here." Gannit tucks his hands in his hip pockets.
"I know that you are born without sight. Some of the travellers on Akiva say you are born without eyes." Gannit shrugs, unsure of what to believe.
"And, to be honest, I'm paying no mind to the Chancery or Vice-Chair elections until the final candidates are...finalized."
Gannit looks at the floor for a moment, realizing his small gaffe, then back to Frea.
"A number of fellow Akivans wanted me to run, but I don't think it right that a fresh face be given the big chair, you know?"

"Pleased to make your acquaintance, Senator. And, I am."
Gannit retracts his hand, somewhat embarrassed at the difference in cleanliness between his and the Corulag senator's.
"Does the Chommel Sector count? Been to Naboo once, about fifteen years ago. Friend's wedding. Absolutely gorgeous. Been to Tatooine more than once, and Geonosis a few times. But I rarely venture off Akiva. Yourself, sir?"

Gannit returns the bow. "It is not, what with the distance between them. At least as of three weeks ago, Akiva fares well. Comms were sporadic on the journey here. But, that's what bulk freighter travel gets you." He lets out a small chuckle.
"I came by, well, to be perfectly honest, ma'am, I've never met a Miraluka before, so, I wanted to meet one, plain and simple as that. That, and to introduce myself to a colleague."
"And I am Gannit Valeris." He extends his hand, his fingernails still dirty with assorted fluids from starships.

"It is. Only populated planet in the immediate area. I once heard a traveller say that 'If there's a bright center to the universe, then it is the planet farthest from'. It's somewhere you go to live, not to visit, if that makes any sense?"

"I'm Gannit Valeris, freshman senator from Akiva, on the Outer Rim. I apologize for my ensemble. I only arrived a few hours ago and haven't unpacked yet. I just recently met the Senator from Corulag. And who might you be, if I may ask?"

Senator Gannit Valeris, after having departed from Space Nate's Place, arrived at the office of Frea Bairn.
Though he was full-human, he wanted to meet his colleagues, especially those of species he had never encountered before.
He calmly, and respectfully, knocked on Senator Bairn's office door.

Gannit removed a small pair of in-ear audio receivers. "I'm sorry, Senator, were you addressing me?" Gannit said, calmly, if not a bit shyly, as he is not used to being in public and amongst the upper echelons of society just yet
"I must apologize. I was enjoying some of the local audio entertainment programming. It is quite a bit different here than on Akiva. The entertainment, that is."
Gannit tucks the earpieces in an inside pocket of his simple brown jacket, one he has obviously had for years, exposing the plain tan shirt he is wearing, still not having adjusted to the luxurious lifestyles many Senators are accustomed to.

Gannit was a freshman Senator from the Outer Rim. He knew no one here. He had run a starship repair chain on Akiva for the last 20-someodd years.
He took a seat at the bar, introducing himself to Sylvern. Unsurprisingly, he had to explain where Akiva was, followed by an order of an extra-large blue milk, for he wasn't much of one to partake in alcohol.

Gannit Valeris, the Senator from Akiva, walks up to you.
"Mind if I join you?"

WRITING.TITLE: [CLAIM] Senator of Akiva
WRITING.TEXT:
Name: Gannit Valeris (Gann-it Val-err-iss)
Sex: Male
Age: 42
Bio: Owner of a mid-sized starship repair chain on Akiva, he ran and was elected Senator of Akiva on the "outsider" ticket, by a margin of 82-20-8, ousting incumbent Senator Barthran Ferhs, a career politician who had long been serving his own interests over Akiva's, having run unopposed for the last five elections, and soundly defeating the Akiva Isolation Movement candidate, Yar Querris, a local prominent, and highly controversial, politician.
Valeris promised to good by Akiva and make them proud, but also to do good for the galaxy, and to do his best to put Akiva, a backwater Outer Rim planet, on the map as a major trading post of the Outer Rim.
The day before swearing in, he handed off running the starship repair chain to his childhood friend and business partner, as a sign of his committal to serving Akiva in the senate.

I came up with this one when I was in elementary school (grades K-5):
* What's a rapper's favorite toy? A yo-yo.

WRITING.TITLE: Have any of you ever browsed the ISS Props site?
WRITING.TEXT:
It's neat to see all the stuff they have on there. (They're the makers of Let's Potato Chips, Heisler Beer and Morley Cigarettes, amongst other things)
Also, poking through their graphics department revealed some rather hilarious magazines, like ["Interpol and You"](http://issprops.com/images/graphics/Interpol.jpg), ["Double Agent"](http://issprops.com/images/graphics/Double_Agent.jpg) and ["Espionage Quarterly"](http://issprops.com/images/graphics/Espionage_Quarterly.jpg).
([link to ISS's homepage](http://issprops.com/))
[Link to their page](http://issprops.com/graphics/products/category/misc)

WRITING.TITLE: One of ISS Props (maker of Let's Chips) available fake magazines

WRITING.TEXT: Well, I still have (and use) my 360, so BC isn't a huge issue for me.

* 1) COD is always rather populous, but the older the game, the lower the pop. And each November, the pop of the prior game drops, since that's when the next installment releases.
* 2) Not sure. But the single player is kick-ass! And the Halo 2 Anniversary cutscenes are fucking gorgeous.
* 3) No idea.
* 4) No idea.
* 5) I know Titanfall and some other games have specific regional servers (e.g. North America, South America, Western Europe...) you can pick from, others are auto-assigned, so it varies by game.
* 6) No idea
* 7) No idea.
* 8) All of them are, but Halo 2 Anniversary is gorgeous on the one. It'll make you contemplate leaving your SO for it. It's that gorgeous.
* 9) Depends on where you are. In the US, it'll probably be $40-50; in Australia, it'll probably be $52,000 plus VAT.
* 10) No idea.

No problem!
I figure the Arcade (Guacamelee, StrikeSuitZero, etc.) are no more than about 5GB, so that'll be close to 100 games.
By default, everything loads to the external, so I have to manually move them to the internal, but it's easier (i.e. faster) to move a 5GB game than a 45GB one.

I also have a WD MyBook 4TB.
4TB / 60GB is 66.66, so, after formatting, say about 60 games.
And the 60GB is a "large" game (for the time being), so it'll probably be closer to 75-80.
Plus, the 500GB internal.
Personally, I put all the Arcade titles on my internal, and the retail hard copies (or retail GWG) on the external.
Hey. It's my million. If I wanted to buy a million packs of gum with it, that's my prerogative.
I'd pay off my mom's house and debt, then my girlfriend's debt, then save the rest.
Yeah. Like I said, Pixar is more family-friendly, so there is a one in a quintillion chance of it happening, but, really, it would be easy for them to go PG-13 with it, albeit a "light" PG-13.

I don't think it would hurt it, necessarily.
I mean, any more, a lot of kids see PG-13 (if not R) movies that would be way worse than a Pixar PG-13 movie by the time they're 10. Or less. Back in 2004, not necessarily, but nowadays, yes.
Honestly, I actually think that if it was PG-13, it could allow some leeway with story development.

WRITING.TITLE: What would you think if The Incredibles II was PG-13?
WRITING.TEXT:
Incredibles 1 was rather hard and dark for a PG movie, especially a Pixar movie.
What are your thoughts on if Incredibles II ends up being Pixar's first PG-13 movie?
(I am aware Pixar is more family-friendly and there's a 99% chance it won't, but humor me here)

'#1 - You Know My Name. Easily the best Bond song.
'#2 - Skyfall.
Both really capture the tone of the film in the music and lyrics. They also explore the more human Bond of the Craig-run, versus the womanizing, nothing-gets-to-him, borderline-superhuman Bond of the classic movies.

I agree with #1. "You Know My Name" is, IMHO, the best Bond theme song.
I'd say #2 is Skyfall.

I love this bit:
"Both Republicans and Democrats passed a temporary spending measure that will keep the government afloat (a move supported by a majority of Americans) through mid-December. After the bill was passed by a vote of 77-19, Cruz theatrically sought a roll-call vote but he was promptly denied by his fellow Republicans, many of whom shouted No! at the Senators request."
When your own party and its leaders hate you, you really need to re-examine your shit.
As a Texan-by-transplant, I'm sorry America.
